intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides subvar. proximum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small and white or pale blue, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months. This subspecies is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
